name: Seth Meyers
monologue: ‘What’s my handicap? I’d say a complete inability to empathize with my fellow human beings, that’s a big one.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Who the f*ck is Hank Tough? That sounds like the name—Hank Tough is Donald Trump’s porn star alter ego.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Trump derangement syndrome, for those who don’t know, is when Trump does something deranged and you, I guess, notice it.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: The new line that losing money costs you nothing. The same people who spent four years screaming about the price of eggs are suddenly turning into Buddhist monks. The next time you turn on Fox News, Sean Hannity’s gonna be there with his head shaved saying, ‘Money is but a mirage, an empty vessel that cannot provide meaning. You came from the dust and to the dust you shall return.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Yeah, it’s like if you’re rushed into the hospital and you flatline, it might not be a bad thing. It just means your heart is taking a nap.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: It’s like when you get back into a relationship with an ex you couldn’t keep up with because of their wild party lifestyle and you think maybe this time things’ll be different. And then a week later, you find yourself in a basement at 5 a.m. surrounded by strangers in Venetian masks on molly, and someone starts to unbutton your shirt and you finally get up the courage to say, ‘Hey, hands off!'

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Your economic policy has the same tagline as Season 3 of Squid Game ?

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: You know what I always say, Live, Laugh Love! It’s 401K somewhere.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: And when did the right become so chill? Aren’t you the ‘Bud Light’s turning my kid’s trans’ folks?

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: So everyone relax. This is merely a routine rat poison colonoscopy.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Their best argument so far for any of this is the same one we got about Tinkerbell being able to fly. You have to believe.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Financial destruction not seen since the pandemic. And this time, there’s no controversy as to how it all started. There’s no wet market. You, Trump, released the contagion. It’s your lab leak, and it’s right out in the open. This is like if the researchers at the Wuhan Institute of Virology walked out to the Great Wall with a Tupperware and went, ‘We have an exciting announcement!'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: He’s only been talking about tariffs since the 1980s. In the campaign, he said that tariff is the most beautiful word in the English language. This is like electing Snoop Dogg and saying, ‘I didn’t know he was gonna smoke weed every day.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Wall Street clearly wants the president to change his mind, but he doesn’t have one.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: That’s a weird thing to brag about. ‘Everybody’s makin’ fun of me for pooping my pants, but jokes on them—I pooped my pants on purpose. While everyone else is playing checkers… I’m poopin’ my pants.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: China, if you want a trade war, then a trade war is what you’ll get! The gloves are off! Because you make the gloves and we can’t afford them any more.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: That is an aggressively tone deaf press release.’ I’m sorry, Mrs. Jones. I botched the operation and your husband is dead. But this morning I got the Wordle in two.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: I know. His brain is broke.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Yes, he’s swinging for the fences. He missed and hit America in the S&P 500, which any economist will tell you stands for Scrotum & Penis 500.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The world champion Los Angeles Dodgers met the draft dodger in chief today at the White House.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It was a unique opportunity to have the franchise that signed Jackie Robinson to meet the president who had him removed from our government websites.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It was another tariffying day on Wall Street. The Dow was down, the S&P was down, cocaine was up.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Hey, I’m not an expert when it comes to the economy, but I am an expert when it comes to nicknames, and “panican

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Remember when he told us to inject bleach to cure Covid? Turns out those were the good ideas.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Trump also skipped out on honoring four fallen soldiers so he could have dinner at Mar-a-Lago. In his defense, it was fajita night.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Of course he won. Anyone who beats him gets sent to El Salvador.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today is National Beer Day. Yeah, it’s a very popular day. In fact, everyone with a 401k has been celebrating since last Wednesday.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Trump defended [the tariffs] by saying, ‘Sometimes you have to take medicine to fix something.’ RFK Jr heard and was like, ‘Then why’d you hire me?'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: When you don’t have an Education Department, you have to start making up your own words.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: To be fair, if there’s anyone’s an expert on stuff crashing, it’s the CEO of Tesla.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today when Trump and Elon started fighting, Eric and Don Jr asked, ‘Are we gonna have two Christmases?'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today the CEO of Spirit Airlines stepped down. He was like, ‘I’m gonna take off,’ and everyone was like, ‘We’ll see.’

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: This is bleak. By Halloween, it’ll be too expensive to use pumpkins for jack o’lanterns. You’re just gonna have to face-paint your ugliest son.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: I didn’t think therapists were allowed to talk about what happens during sessions. Now I’m scared my therapist is going to talk to a reporter like, ‘Yeah, many of my patients are saying that Trump’s presidency has been negatively affecting the vibe of the show they host on CBS.’ It’s like, ‘Rachel, shut up!'

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: Apparently it’s so realistic it even waits three messages to ask for feet pics.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: I mean, men seem to understand video game rules. Maybe they would be better at flirting if they could see their dates had little health bars that go down every time they say something creepy. Like, ‘Oh, you just asked to see a picture of my sister? Well you didn’t just lose points with me, you just lost one life.'
